hanzi-su-wiki:
詠

Значения

Слагать стиха, читать нараспев

Мнемоника

Говорить 言 нараспев, растягивая 永 слова.

Варианты

咏
purpleculture_pinyin:
yǒng
to sing
петь
rtega_mnemonic:
詠詠RS
咏咏		sing, hum, chant
  • speak or sing 言/口 sutra which takes a long time 永
purpleculture_info:
(Simplified: 咏)
Pictophonetic: 永 indicates the sound; 言 (speech) conveys the meaning.
purpleculture_examples:
詠嘆調 [ yǒng tàn diào ]: aria
詠春 [ yǒng chūn ]: Wing Chun; same as 咏春拳 ; Yongchun - "Singing Spring Fist" (Chinese martial art)
purpleculture_tree:
• ⿰ Left to right
    • 言 [ yán ] words, speech; to speak, to say
    • 永 [ yǒng ] long; perpetual, eternal; forever
heisig_chinese_memo: If you chant some words to study after a recitation, there is a good chance they will be stuck in your memory for all eternity.
heisig_constituent: recitation, say, words, keitai, mouth, eternity, drop, water
heisig_story: Listening to the words of poets reciting their poetry is like being transported for a moment into eternity where the rules of everyday life have been suspended.
koohiiStory1: Listening to the words in a recitation of Vogon poetry is worse than spending an eternity in hell. [Note: I assume those 2 reports are to warn against possible confusion with poem (#346) but how can you confuse Vogon poetry with an actual poem? Anyway, it´s the next frame, so it should be easy to keep them straight... Or maybe there´s a kanji for Vogon in RTK3?].
koohiiStory2: If you study some words for a recitation, there is a good chance they will be stuck in your memory for all eternity.
WaniKani_Meaning_Mnemonic: If you want to say how eternity sounds you have to compose a poem. Or an essay. Or a song. Recite those deep thoughts about eternity and impress everyone who hears it.
WaniKani_Meaning_Info: Try to compose a poem about eternity right now. Just jot it down somewhere.
WaniKani_Reading_Mnemonic: You decide to compose a poem about an acorn (えい). The tiny acorn is the perfect vessel for you to say how eternity feels to you.
WaniKani_Reading_Info:
Let me recite the acorn poem to you now:
Acorns start small
Grow up big and tall
Spread their baby acorns for all
Live on for all eternity
Ru_trainchinese: yǒng: (графема) сочинять тематические стихи; воспевать в стихах
Kanshudo_mnemonic: a long time (永) with words (言) will help you compose a poem
chinese_mnemonics_deck__story: Monks open their mouths to chant throughout their life and on through eternity after they die.
humanum_short_description_en:
Jia Jinwen starts from " Yong " from " mouth ", and " Yong " is a sound symbol, which has the same shape as "Shuowen" or body. Jiajin inscriptions are used as names of people and places, and are pronounced " xiang " to indicate auspiciousness (see Linyi He).

"Said Wen": "Ying, singing. From words to sound. Chanting, chanting or from mouth."
humanum_short_description:
甲金文從「永」從「口」，「永」是聲符，與《說文》或體同形。甲金文用作人名、地名，又讀作「祥」，表示吉祥(參何琳儀)。

　　《說文》：「詠，歌也。从言永聲。咏，詠或从口。」

詠詠RS
咏咏 		sing, hum, chant
  • speak or sing 言/口 sutra which takes a long time 永
(Simplified: 咏)
Chinese Definition:
Pictophonetic: 永 indicates the sound; 言 (speech) conveys the meaning.
  • ⿰ Left to right
    • 言 [ yán ] words, speech; to speak, to say
    • 永 [ yǒng ] long; perpetual, eternal; forever
①唱，聲調有抑揚地念：詠贊。歌詠。吟詠。詠唱。
②用詩詞等來描述，抒發感情：詠梅。詠史。詠懷。詠歎。詠歎調(富於抒情的獨唱曲)。
③指詩詞：佳詠。

詠字的基本解释

詠
yǒng
同“咏”。

詠字的汉语字典释义

[①]［yǒng］
［《廣韻》爲命切，去映，云。］
(1)歌唱；曼声长吟。
(2)歌颂。
(3)用歌诗的文学样式写景抒情。
(4)指歌诗等韵文作品。
(5)诗体名。
(6)通“永”。长远。参见“詠想”。

詠字的康熙字典解释

【酉集上】【言字部】　詠； 康熙笔画：13； 页码：页1156第18
【唐韻】【集韻】【韻會】【正韻】?爲命切，音泳。【說文】歌也。【玉篇】長言也。【增韻】詠歌謳吟也。【書·益稷】戛擊鳴球，搏拊琴瑟以詠。【傳】以合詠歌之聲也。【爾雅序】敘詩人之興詠。【疏】詠者，永言也。【前漢·藝文志】詠其聲謂之歌。　又鳥鳴亦曰詠。【陸機·悲哉行】耳悲詠時禽。【註】禽聲應時而變也。　又通作咏。【史記·樂書】歌詠其聲也。【禮·樂記】作歌咏。　又【說文長箋】省作永。【書·舜典】詩言志，歌永言。

詠字的源字形

字源演变：

楷体

詠字的起名意思

暂无。

Chant
Basic explanation of words
Chant
yǒng
Same as "Ying".
Chant
Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①]［yǒng］
["Guangyun" is fate, go to Ying, cloud. ]
(1) Singing; long chanting.
(2) Praise.
(3) Use the literary style of song and poem to write scenery and lyricism.
(4) Refers to verse works such as songs and poems.
(5) Poem name.
(6) Through "forever". long. See "Want to".
Chant
Kangxi dictionary interpretation of words
[You Ji 1] [Words Department] 　 Yong; Kangxi Strokes: 13; Page Number: Page 1156 Page 18
[Tang Yun] [Ji Yun] [Rhyme Meeting] [Zheng Yun]? Cut for fate, sound swimming. [Said Wen] Song Ye. [Jade articles] Long words. [Added rhyme] Chanting songs and singing. 【Book·Yiji】Hit the ball quickly and sing the piano. [Biography] With the voice of chanting songs together. [Erya Preface] The chant of the poet's narrative. 【Sparse】The chanter, always speaks. [Previous Han·Art and Literature History] It is a song that chants its voice.　The song of birds is also called chanting. 【Lu Ji·Sorrowful Travel】Ears sing the poultry of time. [Note] The sound of birds changes from time to time.　It's chanting again. 【Historical Records·Music Book】Singing to its voice. 【Li·Yue Ji】Singing.　 [Said Wen Changjian] Province Zuo Yong. [Book·Shun Dian] Poetry expresses ideals, song always speaks.

yǒng
вм. 咏
Radicals: 言, 永  (say, eternity)
Meaning Mnemonic
If you want to say how eternity sounds you have to compose a poem. Or an essay. Or a song. Recite those deep thoughts about eternity and impress everyone who hears it.
Try to compose a poem about eternity right now. Just jot it down somewhere.
Reading Mnemonic
You decide to compose a poem about an acorn (えい). The tiny acorn is the perfect vessel for you to say how eternity feels to you.
Let me recite the acorn poem to you now:
Acorns start small
Grow up big and tall
Spread their baby acorns for all
Live on for all eternity
